DomainNotWhitelistedException.documentation: The domain specified isn't on the allow list. All domains for embedded dashboards must be added to the approved list by an Amazon QuickSight admin.

ErrorInfo.documentation: Error information for the SPICE ingestion of a dataset.

Host.documentation: The hostname or IP address of the Exasol data source.

Port.documentation: The port for the Exasol data source.

ExasolParameters.documentation: The required parameters for connecting to an Exasol data source.

columns.documentation: A folder has a list of columns. A column can only be in one folder.

FieldFolder.documentation: A FieldFolder element is a folder that contains fields and nested subfolders.

ConditionExpression.documentation: An expression that must evaluate to a Boolean value. Rows for which the expression evaluates to true are kept in the dataset.

FilterOperation.documentation: A transform operation that filters rows based on a condition.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the folder.

FolderPath.documentation: An array of ancestor ARN strings for the folder.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that the folder was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The time that the folder was last updated.

MemberId.documentation: The ID of an asset in the folder.

MemberType.documentation: The type of asset that it is.

FolderMember.documentation: An asset in a Amazon QuickSight folder, such as a dashboard, analysis, or dataset.

Operator.documentation: The comparison operator that you want to use in the filter. For example, "Operator": "StringEquals".

Name.documentation: The name of a value that you want to use in the filter. For example, "Name": "PARENT_FOLDER_ARN".

Value.documentation: The value of the named item (in this example, PARENT_FOLDER_ARN), that you want to use as a filter. For example, "Value": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-east-1:1:folder/folderId".

FolderSearchFilter.documentation: A filter to use to search a Amazon QuickSight folder.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the folder.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that the folder was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The time that the folder was last updated.

FolderSummary.documentation: A summary of information about an existing Amazon QuickSight folder.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains the dashboard that you're embedding.

SessionLifetimeInMinutes.documentation: How many minutes the session is valid. The session lifetime must be in [15-600] minutes range.

Namespace.documentation: The Amazon QuickSight namespace that the anonymous user virtually belongs to. If you are not using an Amazon QuickSight custom namespace, set this to default.

SessionTags.documentation:
The session tags used for row-level security. Before you use this parameter, make sure that you have configured the relevant datasets using the DataSet$RowLevelPermissionTagConfiguration parameter so that session tags can be used to provide row-level security.

These are not the tags used for the Amazon Web Services resource tagging feature. For more information, see Using Row-Level Security (RLS) with Tagsin the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

AuthorizedResourceArns.documentation: The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for the Amazon QuickSight resources that the user is authorized to access during the lifetime of the session. If you choose Dashboard embedding experience, pass the list of dashboard ARNs in the account that you want the user to be able to view. Currently, you can pass up to 25 dashboard ARNs in each API call.

ExperienceConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of the experience that you are embedding.

AllowedDomains.documentation:
The domains that you want to add to the allow list for access to the generated URL that is then embedded. This optional parameter overrides the static domains that are configured in the Manage QuickSight menu in the Amazon QuickSight console. Instead, it allows only the domains that you include in this parameter. You can list up to three domains or subdomains in each API call.

To include all subdomains under a specific domain to the allow list, use *. For example, https://*.sapp.amazon.com includes all subdomains under https://sapp.amazon.com.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains the dashboard that you're embedding.

SessionLifetimeInMinutes.documentation: How many minutes the session is valid. The session lifetime must be in [15-600] minutes range.

UserArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name for the registered user.

ExperienceConfiguration.documentation: The experience you are embedding. For registered users, you can embed Amazon QuickSight dashboards, Amazon QuickSight visuals, the Amazon QuickSight Q search bar, or the entire Amazon QuickSight console.

AllowedDomains.documentation:
The domains that you want to add to the allow list for access to the generated URL that is then embedded. This optional parameter overrides the static domains that are configured in the Manage QuickSight menu in the Amazon QuickSight console. Instead, it allows only the domains that you include in this parameter. You can list up to three domains or subdomains in each API call.

To include all subdomains under a specific domain to the allow list, use *. For example, https://*.sapp.amazon.com includes all subdomains under https://sapp.amazon.com.

EmbedUrl.documentation: The embed URL for the Amazon QuickSight dashboard, visual, Q search bar, or console.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

GeoSpatialColumnGroup.documentation: Geospatial column group that denotes a hierarchy.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains the dashboard that you're embedding.

DashboardId.documentation: The ID for the dashboard, also added to the Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy.

IdentityType.documentation: The authentication method that the user uses to sign in.

SessionLifetimeInMinutes.documentation: How many minutes the session is valid. The session lifetime must be 15-600 minutes.

UndoRedoDisabled.documentation: Remove the undo/redo button on the embedded dashboard. The default is FALSE, which enables the undo/redo button.

ResetDisabled.documentation: Remove the reset button on the embedded dashboard. The default is FALSE, which enables the reset button.

StatePersistenceEnabled.documentation: Adds persistence of state for the user session in an embedded dashboard. Persistence applies to the sheet and the parameter settings. These are control settings that the dashboard subscriber (Amazon QuickSight reader) chooses while viewing the dashboard. If this is set to TRUE, the settings are the same when the subscriber reopens the same dashboard URL. The state is stored in Amazon QuickSight, not in a browser cookie. If this is set to FALSE, the state of the user session is not persisted. The default is FALSE.

UserArn.documentation:
The Amazon QuickSight user's Amazon Resource Name (ARN), for use with QUICKSIGHT identity type. You can use this for any Amazon QuickSight users in your account (readers, authors, or admins) authenticated as one of the following:

  • Active Directory (AD) users or group members

  • Invited nonfederated users

  • IAM users and IAM role-based sessions authenticated through Federated Single Sign-On using SAML, OpenID Connect, or IAM federation.

Omit this parameter for users in the third group – IAM users and IAM role-based sessions.

Namespace.documentation: The Amazon QuickSight namespace that contains the dashboard IDs in this request. If you're not using a custom namespace, set Namespace = default.

AdditionalDashboardIds.documentation: A list of one or more dashboard IDs that you want anonymous users to have tempporary access to. Currently, the IdentityType parameter must be set to ANONYMOUS because other identity types authenticate as Amazon QuickSight or IAM users. For example, if you set "--dashboard-id dash_id1 --dashboard-id dash_id2 dash_id3 identity-type ANONYMOUS", the session can access all three dashboards.

EmbedUrl.documentation: A single-use URL that you can put into your server-side webpage to embed your dashboard. This URL is valid for 5 minutes. The API operation provides the URL with an auth_code value that enables one (and only one) sign-on to a user session that is valid for 10 hours.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account associated with your Amazon QuickSight subscription.

EntryPoint.documentation:
The URL you use to access the embedded session. The entry point URL is constrained to the following paths:

  • /start

  • /start/analyses

  • /start/dashboards

  • /start/favorites

  • /dashboards/DashboardId - where DashboardId is the actual ID key from the Amazon QuickSight console URL of the dashboard

  • /analyses/AnalysisId - where AnalysisId is the actual ID key from the Amazon QuickSight console URL of the analysis

SessionLifetimeInMinutes.documentation: How many minutes the session is valid. The session lifetime must be 15-600 minutes.

UserArn.documentation:
The Amazon QuickSight user's Amazon Resource Name (ARN), for use with QUICKSIGHT identity type. You can use this for any type of Amazon QuickSight users in your account (readers, authors, or admins). They need to be authenticated as one of the following:

  1. Active Directory (AD) users or group members

  2. Invited nonfederated users

  3. Identity and Access Management (IAM) users and IAM role-based sessions authenticated through Federated Single Sign-On using SAML, OpenID Connect, or IAM federation

Omit this parameter for users in the third group, IAM users and IAM role-based sessions.

EmbedUrl.documentation: A single-use URL that you can put into your server-side web page to embed your Amazon QuickSight session. This URL is valid for 5 minutes. The API operation provides the URL with an auth_code value that enables one (and only one) sign-on to a user session that is valid for 10 hours.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the group.

Group.documentation: A group in Amazon QuickSight consists of a set of users. You can use groups to make it easier to manage access and security.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the group member (user).

GroupMember.documentation: A member of an Amazon QuickSight group. Currently, group members must be users. Groups can't be members of another group. .

Operator.documentation: The comparison operator that you want to use as a filter, for example "Operator": "StartsWith". Currently, the only supported operator is StartsWith.

Name.documentation: The name of the value that you want to use as a filter, for example "Name": "GROUP_NAME". Currently, the only supported name is GROUP_NAME.

Value.documentation: The value of the named item, in this case GROUP_NAME, that you want to use as a filter.

GroupSearchFilter.documentation: A GroupSearchFilter object that you want to apply to your search.

Show.documentation: This Boolean value controls whether to display a gutter space between sheet tiles.

GutterStyle.documentation: The display options for gutter spacing between tiles on a sheet.

If you try to make a ListNamespaces API call with an expired token, you will receive a HTTP 400 InvalidNextTokenException error.

The type of themes that you want to list. Valid options include the following:

  • ALL (default)- Display all existing themes.

  • CUSTOM - Display only the themes created by people using Amazon QuickSight.

  • QUICKSIGHT - Display only the starting themes defined by Amazon QuickSight.

Alias.documentation: A display name for the logical table.

DataTransforms.documentation: Transform operations that act on this logical table.

LogicalTable.documentation: A logical table is a unit that joins and that data transformations operate on. A logical table has a source, which can be either a physical table or result of a join. When a logical table points to a physical table, the logical table acts as a mutable copy of that physical table through transform operations.

JoinInstruction.documentation: Specifies the result of a join of two logical tables.

DataSetArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the parent dataset.

LogicalTableSource.documentation: Information about the source of a logical table. This is a variant type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be non-null.

Key.documentation: Amazon S3 key that identifies an object.

Show.documentation: This Boolean value controls whether to display sheet margins.

MarginStyle.documentation: The display options for margins around the outside edge of sheets.

MemberArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the member.

MemberIdArnPair.documentation: An object that consists of a member Amazon Resource Name (ARN) and a member ID.

Arn.documentation: The namespace ARN.

CreationStatus.documentation: The creation status of a namespace that is not yet completely created.

IdentityStore.documentation: The identity store used for the namespace.

NamespaceError.documentation: An error that occurred when the namespace was created.

StringParameters.documentation: The parameters that have a data type of string.

IntegerParameters.documentation: The parameters that have a data type of integer.

DecimalParameters.documentation: The parameters that have a data type of decimal.

DateTimeParameters.documentation: The parameters that have a data type of date-time.

Parameters.documentation: A list of Amazon QuickSight parameters and the list's override values.

RelationalTable.documentation: A physical table type for relational data sources.

CustomSql.documentation: A physical table type built from the results of the custom SQL query.

S3Source.documentation: A physical table type for as S3 data source.

PhysicalTable.documentation: A view of a data source that contains information about the shape of the data in the underlying source. This is a variant type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be non-null.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

ProjectOperation.documentation: A transform operation that projects columns. Operations that come after a projection can only refer to projected columns.

QueuedIngestion.documentation: The ID of the ongoing ingestion. The queued ingestion is waiting for the ongoing ingestion to complete.

QueueInfo.documentation: Information about a queued dataset SPICE ingestion.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

QuickSightUserNotFoundException.documentation: The user with the provided name isn't found. This error can happen in any operation that requires finding a user based on a provided user name, such as DeleteUser, DescribeUser, and so on.

Host.documentation: Host. This field can be blank if ClusterId is provided.

Port.documentation: Port. This field can be blank if the ClusterId is provided.

ClusterId.documentation: Cluster ID. This field can be blank if the Host and Port are provided.

RedshiftParameters.documentation: The parameters for Amazon Redshift. The ClusterId field can be blank if Host and Port are both set. The Host and Port fields can be blank if the ClusterId field is set.

IdentityType.documentation:
Amazon QuickSight supports several ways of managing the identity of users. This parameter accepts two values:

  • IAM: A user whose identity maps to an existing IAM user or role.

  • QUICKSIGHT: A user whose identity is owned and managed internally by Amazon QuickSight.

Email.documentation: The email address of the user that you want to register.

UserRole.documentation:
The Amazon QuickSight role for the user. The user role can be one of the following:

  • READER: A user who has read-only access to dashboards.

  • AUTHOR: A user who can create data sources, datasets, analyses, and dashboards.

  • ADMIN: A user who is an author, who can also manage Amazon QuickSight settings.

  • RESTRICTED_READER: This role isn't currently available for use.

  • RESTRICTED_AUTHOR: This role isn't currently available for use.

IamArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM user or role that you are registering with Amazon QuickSight.

SessionName.documentation: You need to use this parameter only when you register one or more users using an assumed IAM role. You don't need to provide the session name for other scenarios, for example when you are registering an IAM user or an Amazon QuickSight user. You can register multiple users using the same IAM role if each user has a different session name. For more information on assuming IAM roles, see assume-role in the CLI Reference.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that the user is in. Currently, you use the ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains your Amazon QuickSight account.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace. Currently, you should set this to default.

UserName.documentation: The Amazon QuickSight user name that you want to create for the user you are registering.

CustomPermissionsName.documentation:
(Enterprise edition only) The name of the custom permissions profile that you want to assign to this user. Customized permissions allows you to control a user's access by restricting access the following operations:

  • Create and update data sources

  • Create and update datasets

  • Create and update email reports

  • Subscribe to email reports

To add custom permissions to an existing user, use UpdateUser instead.

A set of custom permissions includes any combination of these restrictions. Currently, you need to create the profile names for custom permission sets by using the Amazon QuickSight console. Then, you use the RegisterUser API operation to assign the named set of permissions to a Amazon QuickSight user.

Amazon QuickSight custom permissions are applied through IAM policies. Therefore, they override the permissions typically granted by assigning Amazon QuickSight users to one of the default security cohorts in Amazon QuickSight (admin, author, reader).

This feature is available only to Amazon QuickSight Enterprise edition subscriptions.

ExternalLoginFederationProviderType.documentation:
The type of supported external login provider that provides identity to let a user federate into Amazon QuickSight with an associated Identity and Access Management(IAM) role. The type of supported external login provider can be one of the following.

  • COGNITO: Amazon Cognito. The provider URL is cognito-identity.amazonaws.com. When choosing the COGNITO provider type, don’t use the "CustomFederationProviderUrl" parameter which is only needed when the external provider is custom.

  • CUSTOM_OIDC: Custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider. When choosing CUSTOM_OIDC type, use the CustomFederationProviderUrl parameter to provide the custom OIDC provider URL.

CustomFederationProviderUrl.documentation: The URL of the custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider that provides identity to let a user federate into Amazon QuickSight with an associated Identity and Access Management(IAM) role. This parameter should only be used when ExternalLoginFederationProviderType parameter is set to CUSTOM_OIDC.

ExternalLoginId.documentation: The identity ID for a user in the external login provider.

UserInvitationUrl.documentation: The URL the user visits to complete registration and provide a password. This is returned only for users with an identity type of QUICKSIGHT.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

InitialDashboardId.documentation:
The dashboard ID for the dashboard that you want the user to see first. This ID is included in the output URL. When the URL in response is accessed, Amazon QuickSight renders this dashboard if the user has permissions to view it.

If the user does not have permission to view this dashboard, they see a permissions error message.

RegisteredUserDashboardEmbeddingConfigur.documentation: Information about the dashboard you want to embed.

InitialDashboardVisualId.documentation:
The visual ID for the visual that you want the user to embed. This ID is included in the output URL. When the URL in response is accessed, Amazon QuickSight renders this visual.

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dashboard that the visual belongs to must be included in the AuthorizedResourceArns parameter. Otherwise, the request will fail with InvalidParameterValueException.

RegisteredUserDashboardVisualEmbeddingCo.documentation: The experience that you are embedding. You can use this object to generate a url that embeds a visual into your application.

Dashboard.documentation: The configuration details for providing a dashboard embedding experience.

QuickSightConsole.documentation:
The configuration details for providing each Amazon QuickSight console embedding experience. This can be used along with custom permissions to restrict access to certain features. For more information, see Customizing Access to the Amazon QuickSight Console in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

Use GenerateEmbedUrlForRegisteredUser where you want to provide an authoring portal that allows users to create data sources, datasets, analyses, and dashboards. The users who accesses an embedded Amazon QuickSight console needs to belong to the author or admin security cohort. If you want to restrict permissions to some of these features, add a custom permissions profile to the user with the UpdateUser API operation. Use the RegisterUser API operation to add a new user with a custom permission profile attached. For more information, see the following sections in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide:

  • Embedding the Full Functionality of the Amazon QuickSight Console for Authenticated Users

  • Customizing Access to the Amazon QuickSight Console

For more information about the high-level steps for embedding and for an interactive demo of the ways you can customize embedding, visit the Amazon QuickSight Developer Portal.

QSearchBar.documentation:
The configuration details for embedding the Q search bar.

For more information about embedding the Q search bar, see Embedding Overview in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

DashboardVisual.documentation: The type of embedding experience. In this case, Amazon QuickSight visuals.

RegisteredUserEmbeddingExperienceConfigu.documentation:
The type of experience you want to embed. For registered users, you can embed Amazon QuickSight dashboards or the Amazon QuickSight console.

Exactly one of the experience configurations is required. You can choose Dashboard or QuickSightConsole. You cannot choose more than one experience configuration.

InitialTopicId.documentation:
The ID of the Q topic that you want to make the starting topic in the Q search bar. You can find a topic ID by navigating to the Topics pane in the Amazon QuickSight application and opening a topic. The ID is in the URL for the topic that you open.

If you don't specify an initial topic, a list of all shared topics is shown in the Q bar for your readers. When you select an initial topic, you can specify whether or not readers are allowed to select other topics from the available ones in the list.

RegisteredUserQSearchBarEmbeddingConfigu.documentation: Information about the Q search bar embedding experience.

InitialPath.documentation:
The initial URL path for the Amazon QuickSight console. InitialPath is required.

The entry point URL is constrained to the following paths:

  • /start

  • /start/analyses

  • /start/dashboards

  • /start/favorites

  • /dashboards/DashboardId. DashboardId is the actual ID key from the Amazon QuickSight console URL of the dashboard.

  • /analyses/AnalysisId. AnalysisId is the actual ID key from the Amazon QuickSight console URL of the analysis.

RegisteredUserQuickSightConsoleEmbedding.documentation: Information about the Amazon QuickSight console that you want to embed.

DataSourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the data source.

Schema.documentation: The schema name. This name applies to certain relational database engines.

RelationalTable.documentation: A physical table type for relational data sources.

ColumnName.documentation: The name of the column to be renamed.

RenameColumnOperation.documentation: A transform operation that renames a column.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.
The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: One or more resources can't be found.

Principal.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal. This can be one of the following:

  • The ARN of an Amazon QuickSight user or group associated with a data source or dataset. (This is common.)

  • The ARN of an Amazon QuickSight user, group, or namespace associated with an analysis, dashboard, template, or theme. (This is common.)

  • The ARN of an Amazon Web Services account root: This is an IAM ARN rather than a QuickSight ARN. Use this option only to share resources (templates) across Amazon Web Services accounts. (This is less common.)

Actions.documentation: The IAM action to grant or revoke permissions on.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the analysis.

AnalysisId.documentation: The ID of the analysis that you're restoring.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the analysis that you're restoring.

AnalysisId.documentation: The ID of the analysis that you're restoring.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

RowsIngested.documentation: The number of rows that were ingested.

RowsDropped.documentation: The number of rows that were not ingested.

TotalRowsInDataset.documentation: The total number of rows in the dataset.

RowInfo.documentation: Information about rows for a data set SPICE ingestion.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace associated with the dataset that contains permissions for RLS.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset that contains permissions for RLS.

PermissionPolicy.documentation: The type of permissions to use when interpreting the permissions for RLS. DENY_ACCESS is included for backward compatibility only.

FormatVersion.documentation:
The user or group rules associated with the dataset that contains permissions for RLS.

By default, FormatVersion is VERSION_1. When FormatVersion is VERSION_1, UserName and GroupName are required. When FormatVersion is VERSION_2, UserARN and GroupARN are required, and Namespace must not exist.

Status.documentation: The status of the row-level security permission dataset. If enabled, the status is ENABLED. If disabled, the status is DISABLED.

RowLevelPermissionDataSet.documentation:
Information about a dataset that contains permissions for row-level security (RLS). The permissions dataset maps fields to users or groups. For more information, see Using Row-Level Security (RLS) to Restrict Access to a Dataset in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

The option to deny permissions by setting PermissionPolicy to DENY_ACCESS is not supported for new RLS datasets.

Status.documentation: The status of row-level security tags. If enabled, the status is ENABLED. If disabled, the status is DISABLED.

TagRules.documentation: A set of rules associated with row-level security, such as the tag names and columns that they are assigned to.

RowLevelPermissionTagConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of tags on a dataset to set row-level security.

ColumnName.documentation: The column name that a tag key is assigned to.

TagMultiValueDelimiter.documentation: A string that you want to use to delimit the values when you pass the values at run time. For example, you can delimit the values with a comma.

MatchAllValue.documentation: A string that you want to use to filter by all the values in a column in the dataset and don’t want to list the values one by one. For example, you can use an asterisk as your match all value.

RowLevelPermissionTagRule.documentation: A set of rules associated with a tag.

ManifestFileLocation.documentation: Location of the Amazon S3 manifest file. This is NULL if the manifest file was uploaded into Amazon QuickSight.

DataSourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the data source.

UploadSettings.documentation: Information about the format for the S3 source file or files.

InputColumns.documentation:
A physical table type for an S3 data source.

For files that aren't JSON, only STRING data types are supported in input columns.

S3Source.documentation: A physical table type for an S3 data source.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the analyses that you're searching for.

Filters.documentation: The structure for the search filters that you want to apply to your search.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token that can be used in a subsequent request.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return.

AnalysisSummaryList.documentation: Metadata describing the analyses that you searched for.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to be returned per request.

DashboardSummaryList.documentation: The list of dashboards owned by the user specified in Filters in your request.

Filters.documentation: The filters to apply to the search. Currently, you can search only by the parent folder ARN. For example, "Filters": [ { "Name": "PARENT_FOLDER_ARN", "Operator": "StringEquals", "Value": "arn:aws:quicksight:us-east-1:1:folder/folderId" } ].

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no more results.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to be returned per request.

FolderSummaryList.documentation: A structure that contains all of the folders in the Amazon Web Services account. This structure provides basic information about the folders.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no more results.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that the group is in. Currently, you use the ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains your Amazon QuickSight account.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token that can be used in a subsequent request.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return from this request.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace that you want to search.

Filters.documentation: The structure for the search filters that you want to apply to your search.

GroupList.documentation: A list of groups in a specified namespace that match the filters you set in your SearchGroups request.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token that can be used in a subsequent request.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.
The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

SessionLifetimeInMinutesInvalidException.documentation: The number of minutes specified for the lifetime of a session isn't valid. The session lifetime must be 15-600 minutes.

Value.documentation: The value that you want to assign the tag.

SessionTag.documentation: The key-value pair used for the row-level security tags feature.

SheetId.documentation: The unique identifier associated with a sheet.

Name.documentation: The name of a sheet. This name is displayed on the sheet's tab in the Amazon QuickSight console.

Sheet.documentation: A sheet, which is an object that contains a set of visuals that are viewed together on one page in Amazon QuickSight. Every analysis and dashboard contains at least one sheet. Each sheet contains at least one visualization widget, for example a chart, pivot table, or narrative insight. Sheets can be associated with other components, such as controls, filters, and so on.

IAMUser.documentation: A Boolean that is TRUE if the Amazon QuickSight uses IAM as an authentication method.

userLoginName.documentation: The user login name for your Amazon QuickSight account.

accountName.documentation: The name of your Amazon QuickSight account.

directoryType.documentation: The type of Active Directory that is being used to authenticate the Amazon QuickSight account. Valid values are SIMPLE_AD, AD_CONNECTOR, and MICROSOFT_AD.

SignupResponse.documentation: A SignupResponse object that contains a summary of a newly created account.

DisableSsl.documentation: A Boolean option to control whether SSL should be disabled.

SslProperties.documentation: Secure Socket Layer (SSL) properties that apply when Amazon QuickSight connects to your underlying data source.

Name.documentation: A display name for a string parameter.

Tag.documentation: The key or keys of the key-value pairs for the resource tag or tags assigned to the resource.

ColumnName.documentation: The column that this operation acts on.

Tags.documentation:
The dataset column tag, currently only used for geospatial type tagging.

This is not tags for the Amazon Web Services tagging feature.

TagColumnOperation.documentation: A transform operation that tags a column with additional information.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to tag.

Tags.documentation: Contains a map of the key-value pairs for the resource tag or tags assigned to the resource.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.

Version.documentation: A structure describing the versions of the template.

TemplateId.documentation: The ID for the template. This is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

CreatedTime.documentation: Time when this was created.

Template.documentation:
A template object. A template is an entity in Amazon QuickSight that encapsulates the metadata required to create an analysis and that you can use to create a dashboard. A template adds a layer of abstraction by using placeholders to replace the dataset associated with an analysis. You can use templates to create dashboards by replacing dataset placeholders with datasets that follow the same schema that was used to create the source analysis and template.

You can share templates across Amazon Web Services accounts by allowing users in other Amazon Web Services accounts to create a template or a dashboard from an existing template.

AliasName.documentation: The display name of the template alias.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template alias.

TemplateVersionNumber.documentation: The version number of the template alias.

TemplateError.documentation: List of errors that occurred when the template version creation failed.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

DataSetReferences.documentation: A structure containing information about the dataset references used as placeholders in the template.

SourceAnalysis.documentation: The source analysis, if it is based on an analysis.

SourceTemplate.documentation: The source template, if it is based on an template.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
A summary of a template.

TemplateId.documentation: The ID of the template. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

LatestVersionNumber.documentation: A structure containing a list of version numbers for the template summary.

CreatedTime.documentation: The last time that this template was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The last time that this template was updated.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that this template version was created.

VersionNumber.documentation: The version number of the template version.

DataSetConfigurations.documentation: Schema of the dataset identified by the placeholder. Any dashboard created from this template should be bound to new datasets matching the same schema described through this API operation.

SourceEntityArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an analysis or template that was used to create this template.

ThemeArn.documentation: The ARN of the theme associated with this version of the template.

Sheets.documentation: A list of the associated sheets with the unique identifier and name of each sheet.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template version.

VersionNumber.documentation: The version number of the template version.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the theme.

Name.documentation: The name that the user gives to the theme.

ThemeId.documentation: The identifier that the user gives to the theme.

CreatedTime.documentation: The date and time that the theme was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The date and time that the theme was last updated.

Type.documentation: The type of theme, based on how it was created. Valid values include: QUICKSIGHT and CUSTOM.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the theme alias.

AliasName.documentation: The display name of the theme alias.

ThemeVersionNumber.documentation: The version number of the theme alias.

DataColorPalette.documentation: Color properties that apply to chart data colors.

UIColorPalette.documentation: Color properties that apply to the UI and to charts, excluding the colors that apply to data.

ThemeConfiguration.documentation: The theme configuration. This configuration contains all of the display properties for a theme.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

ThemeId.documentation: The ID of the theme. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

LatestVersionNumber.documentation: The latest version number for the theme.

CreatedTime.documentation: The date and time that this theme was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The last date and time that this theme was updated.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

BaseThemeId.documentation: The Amazon QuickSight-defined ID of the theme that a custom theme inherits from. All themes initially inherit from a default Amazon QuickSight theme.

CreatedTime.documentation: The date and time that this theme version was created.

Configuration.documentation: The theme configuration, which contains all the theme display properties.

VersionNumber.documentation: The version number of the theme version.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the theme version.

CreatedTime.documentation: The date and time that this theme version was created.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

Gutter.documentation: The gutter settings that apply between tiles.

Margin.documentation: The margin settings that apply around the outside edge of sheets.

TileLayoutStyle.documentation: The display options for the layout of tiles on a sheet.

TileStyle.documentation: Display options related to tiles on a sheet.

ProjectOperation.documentation: An operation that projects columns. Operations that come after a projection can only refer to projected columns.

FilterOperation.documentation: An operation that filters rows based on some condition.

CreateColumnsOperation.documentation: An operation that creates calculated columns. Columns created in one such operation form a lexical closure.

CastColumnTypeOperation.documentation: A transform operation that casts a column to a different type.

TagColumnOperation.documentation: An operation that tags a column with additional information.

TransformOperation.documentation: A data transformation on a logical table. This is a variant type structure. For this structure to be valid, only one of the attributes can be non-null.

MaxRows.documentation: Maximum number of rows to query Twitter.

PrimaryForeground.documentation: The color of text and other foreground elements that appear over the primary background regions, such as grid lines, borders, table banding, icons, and so on.

PrimaryBackground.documentation: The background color that applies to visuals and other high emphasis UI.

SecondaryForeground.documentation: The foreground color that applies to any sheet title, sheet control text, or UI that appears over the secondary background.

SecondaryBackground.documentation: The background color that applies to the sheet background and sheet controls.

Accent.documentation: This color is that applies to selected states and buttons.

AccentForeground.documentation: The foreground color that applies to any text or other elements that appear over the accent color.

Danger.documentation: The color that applies to error messages.

DangerForeground.documentation: The foreground color that applies to any text or other elements that appear over the error color.

Warning.documentation: This color that applies to warning and informational messages.

WarningForeground.documentation: The foreground color that applies to any text or other elements that appear over the warning color.

Success.documentation: The color that applies to success messages, for example the check mark for a successful download.

SuccessForeground.documentation: The foreground color that applies to any text or other elements that appear over the success color.

Dimension.documentation: The color that applies to the names of fields that are identified as dimensions.

DimensionForeground.documentation: The foreground color that applies to any text or other elements that appear over the dimension color.

Measure.documentation: The color that applies to the names of fields that are identified as measures.

MeasureForeground.documentation: The foreground color that applies to any text or other elements that appear over the measure color.

UIColorPalette.documentation: The theme colors that apply to UI and to charts, excluding data colors. The colors description is a hexadecimal color code that consists of six alphanumerical characters, prefixed with #, for example #37BFF5. For more information, see Using Themes in Amazon QuickSight in the Amazon QuickSight User Guide.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

UnsupportedPricingPlanException.documentation:
This error indicates that you are calling an embedding operation in Amazon QuickSight without the required pricing plan on your Amazon Web Services account. Before you can use embedding for anonymous users, a QuickSight administrator needs to add capacity pricing to Amazon QuickSight. You can do this on the Manage Amazon QuickSight page.

After capacity pricing is added, you can use the GetDashboardEmbedUrl API operation with the --identity-type ANONYMOUS option.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this request.

UnsupportedUserEditionException.documentation: This error indicates that you are calling an operation on an Amazon QuickSight subscription where the edition doesn't include support for that operation. Amazon Amazon QuickSight currently has Standard Edition and Enterprise Edition. Not every operation and capability is available in every edition.

ColumnName.documentation: The column that this operation acts on.

TagNames.documentation: The column tags to remove from this column.

UntagColumnOperation.documentation: A transform operation that removes tags associated with a column.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to untag.

TagKeys.documentation: The keys of the key-value pairs for the resource tag or tags assigned to the resource.

AccountCustomization.documentation: The Amazon QuickSight customizations you're updating in the current Amazon Web Services Region.

DefaultNamespace.documentation: The default namespace for this Amazon Web Services account. Currently, the default is default. Identity and Access Management (IAM) users that register for the first time with Amazon QuickSight provide an email address that becomes associated with the default namespace.

NotificationEmail.documentation: The email address that you want Amazon QuickSight to send notifications to regarding your Amazon Web Services account or Amazon QuickSight subscription.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the analysis whose permissions you're updating. You must be using the Amazon Web Services account that the analysis is in.

AnalysisId.documentation: The ID of the analysis whose permissions you're updating. The ID is part of the analysis URL.

GrantPermissions.documentation: A structure that describes the permissions to add and the principal to add them to.

RevokePermissions.documentation: A structure that describes the permissions to remove and the principal to remove them from.

AnalysisArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the analysis that you updated.

AnalysisId.documentation: The ID of the analysis that you updated permissions for.

Permissions.documentation: A structure that describes the principals and the resource-level permissions on an analysis.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the analysis that you're updating.

AnalysisId.documentation: The ID for the analysis that you're updating. This ID displays in the URL of the analysis.

Name.documentation: A descriptive name for the analysis that you're updating. This name displays for the analysis in the Amazon QuickSight console.

Parameters.documentation: The parameter names and override values that you want to use. An analysis can have any parameter type, and some parameters might accept multiple values.

SourceEntity.documentation: A source entity to use for the analysis that you're updating. This metadata structure contains details that describe a source template and one or more datasets.

ThemeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the theme to apply to the analysis that you're creating. To see the theme in the Amazon QuickSight console, make sure that you have access to it.

Arn.documentation: The ARN of the analysis that you're updating.

UpdateStatus.documentation: The update status of the last update that was made to the analysis.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the dashboard whose permissions you're updating.

GrantPermissions.documentation: The permissions that you want to grant on this resource.

RevokePermissions.documentation: The permissions that you want to revoke from this resource.

GrantLinkPermissions.documentation: Grants link permissions to all users in a defined namespace.

RevokeLinkPermissions.documentation: Revokes link permissions from all users in a defined namespace.

DashboardArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dashboard.

Permissions.documentation: Information about the permissions on the dashboard.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

LinkSharingConfiguration.documentation: Updates the permissions of a shared link to an Amazon QuickSight dashboard.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the dashboard that you're updating.

DashboardArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dashboard.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the dashboard that you're updating.

SourceEntity.documentation:
The entity that you are using as a source when you update the dashboard. In SourceEntity, you specify the type of object you're using as source. You can only update a dashboard from a template, so you use a SourceTemplate entity. If you need to update a dashboard from an analysis, first convert the analysis to a template by using the CreateTemplate API operation. For SourceTemplate, specify the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source template. The SourceTemplate ARN can contain any Amazon Web Services account and any Amazon QuickSight-supported Amazon Web Services Region.

Use the DataSetReferences entity within SourceTemplate to list the replacement datasets for the placeholders listed in the original. The schema in each dataset must match its placeholder.

Parameters.documentation: A structure that contains the parameters of the dashboard. These are parameter overrides for a dashboard. A dashboard can have any type of parameters, and some parameters might accept multiple values.

VersionDescription.documentation: A description for the first version of the dashboard being created.

DashboardPublishOptions.documentation:
Options for publishing the dashboard when you create it:

  • AvailabilityStatus for AdHocFilteringOption - This status can be either ENABLED or DISABLED. When this is set to DISABLED, Amazon QuickSight disables the left filter pane on the published dashboard, which can be used for ad hoc (one-time) filtering. This option is ENABLED by default.

  • AvailabilityStatus for ExportToCSVOption - This status can be either ENABLED or DISABLED. The visual option to export data to .CSV format isn't enabled when this is set to DISABLED. This option is ENABLED by default.

  • VisibilityState for SheetControlsOption - This visibility state can be either COLLAPSED or EXPANDED. This option is COLLAPSED by default.

ThemeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the theme that is being used for this dashboard. If you add a value for this field, it overrides the value that was originally associated with the entity. The theme ARN must exist in the same Amazon Web Services account where you create the dashboard.

VersionArn.documentation: The ARN of the dashboard, including the version number.

RevokePermissions.documentation: The resource permissions that you want to revoke from the dataset.

PhysicalTableMap.documentation: Declares the physical tables that are available in the underlying data sources.

LogicalTableMap.documentation: Configures the combination and transformation of the data from the physical tables.

ColumnGroups.documentation: Groupings of columns that work together in certain Amazon QuickSight features. Currently, only geospatial hierarchy is supported.

FieldFolders.documentation: The folder that contains fields and nested subfolders for your dataset.

RowLevelPermissionDataSet.documentation: The row-level security configuration for the data you want to create.

RowLevelPermissionTagConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of tags on a dataset to set row-level security. Row-level security tags are currently supported for anonymous embedding only.

ColumnLevelPermissionRules.documentation: A set of one or more definitions of a ColumnLevelPermissionRule .

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset.

DataSetId.documentation: The ID for the dataset that you want to create. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

IngestionArn.documentation: The ARN for the ingestion, which is triggered as a result of dataset creation if the import mode is SPICE.

IngestionId.documentation: The ID of the ingestion, which is triggered as a result of dataset creation if the import mode is SPICE.

DataSourceId.documentation: The ID of the data source. This ID is unique per Amazon Web Services Region for each Amazon Web Services account.

Credentials.documentation: The credentials that Amazon QuickSight that uses to connect to your underlying source. Currently, only credentials based on user name and password are supported.

VpcConnectionProperties.documentation: Use this parameter only when you want Amazon QuickSight to use a VPC connection when connecting to your underlying source.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the IAM policy assignment.

AssignmentName.documentation: The name of the assignment, also called a rule. This name must be unique within an Amazon Web Services account.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace of the assignment.

AssignmentStatus.documentation:
The status of the assignment. Possible values are as follows:

  • ENABLED - Anything specified in this assignment is used when creating the data source.

  • DISABLED - This assignment isn't used when creating the data source.

  • DRAFT - This assignment is an unfinished draft and isn't used when creating the data source.

PolicyArn.documentation: The ARN for the IAM policy to apply to the Amazon QuickSight users and groups specified in this assignment.

Identities.documentation: The Amazon QuickSight users, groups, or both that you want to assign the policy to.

AssignmentName.documentation: The name of the assignment or rule.

PolicyArn.documentation: The ARN for the IAM policy applied to the Amazon QuickSight users and groups specified in this assignment.

Identities.documentation: The Amazon QuickSight users, groups, or both that the IAM policy is assigned to.

AssignmentStatus.documentation:
The status of the assignment. Possible values are as follows:

  • ENABLED - Anything specified in this assignment is used when creating the data source.

  • DISABLED - This assignment isn't used when creating the data source.

  • DRAFT - This assignment is an unfinished draft and isn't used when creating the data source.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the IP rules.

IpRestrictionRuleMap.documentation: A map that describes the updated IP rules with CIDR ranges and descriptions.

Enabled.documentation: A value that specifies whether IP rules are turned on.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the IP rules.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID associated with your Amazon QuickSight subscription.

PublicSharingEnabled.documentation: A Boolean value that indicates whether public sharing is turned on for an Amazon QuickSight account.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the template alias that you're updating.

AliasName.documentation: The alias of the template that you want to update. If you name a specific alias, you update the version that the alias points to. You can specify the latest version of the template by providing the keyword $LATEST in the AliasName parameter. The keyword $PUBLISHED doesn't apply to templates.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the template.

GrantPermissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions to be granted on the template.

RevokePermissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions to be revoked from the template.

TemplateArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.

Permissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions to be set on the template.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the template that you're updating.

SourceEntity.documentation:
The entity that you are using as a source when you update the template. In SourceEntity, you specify the type of object you're using as source: SourceTemplate for a template or SourceAnalysis for an analysis. Both of these require an Amazon Resource Name (ARN). For SourceTemplate, specify the ARN of the source template. For SourceAnalysis, specify the ARN of the source analysis. The SourceTemplate ARN can contain any Amazon Web Services account and any Amazon QuickSight-supported Amazon Web Services Region;.

Use the DataSetReferences entity within SourceTemplate or SourceAnalysis to list the replacement datasets for the placeholders listed in the original. The schema in each dataset must match its placeholder.

VersionDescription.documentation: A description of the current template version that is being updated. Every time you call UpdateTemplate, you create a new version of the template. Each version of the template maintains a description of the version in the VersionDescription field.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the template.

VersionArn.documentation: The ARN for the template, including the version information of the first version.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the theme alias that you're updating.

AliasName.documentation: The name of the theme alias that you want to update.

ThemeVersionNumber.documentation: The version number of the theme that the alias should reference.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the theme.

GrantPermissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions to be granted for the theme.

RevokePermissions.documentation: A list of resource permissions to be revoked from the theme.

ThemeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the theme.

Permissions.documentation: The resulting list of resource permissions for the theme.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that contains the theme that you're updating.

BaseThemeId.documentation: The theme ID, defined by Amazon QuickSight, that a custom theme inherits from. All themes initially inherit from a default Amazon QuickSight theme.

VersionDescription.documentation: A description of the theme version that you're updating Every time that you call UpdateTheme, you create a new version of the theme. Each version of the theme maintains a description of the version in VersionDescription.

Configuration.documentation: The theme configuration, which contains the theme display properties.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the theme.

VersionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the new version of the theme.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

UserName.documentation: The Amazon QuickSight user name that you want to update.

AwsAccountId.documentation: The ID for the Amazon Web Services account that the user is in. Currently, you use the ID for the Amazon Web Services account that contains your Amazon QuickSight account.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace. Currently, you should set this to default.

Email.documentation: The email address of the user that you want to update.

Role.documentation:
The Amazon QuickSight role of the user. The role can be one of the following default security cohorts:

  • READER: A user who has read-only access to dashboards.

  • AUTHOR: A user who can create data sources, datasets, analyses, and dashboards.

  • ADMIN: A user who is an author, who can also manage Amazon QuickSight settings.

The name of the Amazon QuickSight role is invisible to the user except for the console screens dealing with permissions.

CustomPermissionsName.documentation:
(Enterprise edition only) The name of the custom permissions profile that you want to assign to this user. Customized permissions allows you to control a user's access by restricting access the following operations:

  • Create and update data sources

  • Create and update datasets

  • Create and update email reports

  • Subscribe to email reports

A set of custom permissions includes any combination of these restrictions. Currently, you need to create the profile names for custom permission sets by using the Amazon QuickSight console. Then, you use the RegisterUser API operation to assign the named set of permissions to a Amazon QuickSight user.

Amazon QuickSight custom permissions are applied through IAM policies. Therefore, they override the permissions typically granted by assigning Amazon QuickSight users to one of the default security cohorts in Amazon QuickSight (admin, author, reader).

This feature is available only to Amazon QuickSight Enterprise edition subscriptions.

UnapplyCustomPermissions.documentation: A flag that you use to indicate that you want to remove all custom permissions from this user. Using this parameter resets the user to the state it was in before a custom permissions profile was applied. This parameter defaults to NULL and it doesn't accept any other value.

ExternalLoginFederationProviderType.documentation:
The type of supported external login provider that provides identity to let a user federate into Amazon QuickSight with an associated Identity and Access Management(IAM) role. The type of supported external login provider can be one of the following.

  • COGNITO: Amazon Cognito. The provider URL is cognito-identity.amazonaws.com. When choosing the COGNITO provider type, don’t use the "CustomFederationProviderUrl" parameter which is only needed when the external provider is custom.

  • CUSTOM_OIDC: Custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider. When choosing CUSTOM_OIDC type, use the CustomFederationProviderUrl parameter to provide the custom OIDC provider URL.

  • NONE: This clears all the previously saved external login information for a user. Use the DescribeUser API operation to check the external login information.

CustomFederationProviderUrl.documentation: The URL of the custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider that provides identity to let a user federate into Amazon QuickSight with an associated Identity and Access Management(IAM) role. This parameter should only be used when ExternalLoginFederationProviderType parameter is set to CUSTOM_OIDC.

ExternalLoginId.documentation: The identity ID for a user in the external login provider.

RequestId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services request ID for this operation.

StartFromRow.documentation: A row number to start reading data from.

ContainsHeader.documentation: Whether the file has a header row, or the files each have a header row.

Delimiter.documentation: The delimiter between values in the file.

UploadSettings.documentation: Information about the format for a source file or files.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the user.

UserName.documentation: The user's user name. This value is required if you are registering a user that will be managed in Amazon QuickSight. In the output, the value for UserName is N/A when the value for IdentityType is IAM and the corresponding IAM user is deleted.

Role.documentation:
The Amazon QuickSight role for the user. The user role can be one of the following:.

  • READER: A user who has read-only access to dashboards.

  • AUTHOR: A user who can create data sources, datasets, analyses, and dashboards.

  • ADMIN: A user who is an author, who can also manage Amazon Amazon QuickSight settings.

  • RESTRICTED_READER: This role isn't currently available for use.

  • RESTRICTED_AUTHOR: This role isn't currently available for use.

IdentityType.documentation: The type of identity authentication used by the user.

Active.documentation: The active status of user. When you create an Amazon QuickSight user that’s not an IAM user or an Active Directory user, that user is inactive until they sign in and provide a password.

CustomPermissionsName.documentation: The custom permissions profile associated with this user.

ExternalLoginFederationProviderType.documentation:
The type of supported external login provider that provides identity to let the user federate into Amazon QuickSight with an associated IAM role. The type can be one of the following.

  • COGNITO: Amazon Cognito. The provider URL is cognito-identity.amazonaws.com.

  • CUSTOM_OIDC: Custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider.

ExternalLoginFederationProviderUrl.documentation: The URL of the external login provider.

ExternalLoginId.documentation: The identity ID for the user in the external login provider.

VpcConnectionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the VPC connection.

documentation:
Amazon QuickSight API Reference

Amazon QuickSight is a fully managed, serverless business intelligence service for the Amazon Web Services Cloud that makes it easy to extend data and insights to every user in your organization. This API reference contains documentation for a programming interface that you can use to manage Amazon QuickSight.
